quotes.t: By and large, they made these changes with {qword}specious{/qword} explanations or no explanation at all. Today, when curricula list rhetoric as a subject, it usually means simply the study of how to write effectively.

Forty years ago I was not yet thirty, and my father still held to the hope that I would come to my senses, abandon the practice of journalism, and follow a career in one of the Wall Street money trades. As a young man during the Great Depression he had labored briefly as a city-room reporter for William Randolph Hearst's {it}San Francisco Examiner{/it}, and he knew that the game was poorly paid and usually rigged, more often than not a matter of converting {qword}specious{/qword} rumor into dubious fact.

One must always guard the interests of one's constituency in the public forum even when its claims are weak or perhaps {qword}specious{/qword}, lest one's opponents steal the march in the never-ending battle for resources or public support.
